channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump holds a rambling news conference while Harris and Walz make stops on debut tour
item.description: Former President Donald Trump gave a rambling news conference Thursday -- the first since Vice President Kamala Harris announced her running mate.
item.content:encoded: Former President Donald Trump gave a rambling news conference Thursday -- the first since Vice President Kamala Harris announced her running mate.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Harris and Trump will debate in September. And, a COVID mystery unraveled
item.description: Vice President Harris and former President Trump have agreed to a debate on Sept. 10. Two other debates are also possible within the same month. And, doctors unravel a COVID mystery.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris and former President Trump have agreed to a debate on Sept. 10. Two other debates are also possible within the same month. And, doctors unravel a COVID mystery.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Ukraine presses offensive inside Russia as Moscow scrambles to respond
item.description: Video on social media shows long lines of Russia civilians driving out of villages to escape the fighting. Some plead for help from Russian President Vladimir Putin, saying they fear for their lives.
item.content:encoded:
Video on social media shows long lines of Russia civilians driving out of villages to escape the fighting. Some plead for help from Russian President Vladimir Putin, saying they fear for their lives.

(Image credit: Alexei Smirnov)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Public health advocates push Olympics to drop Coca-Cola sponsorship
item.description: The soft-drink giant is one of the Olympics' biggest sponsors. But advocates argue pushing sugary beverages promotes obesity and diabetes worldwide, and is inconsistent with the values of the games.
item.content:encoded:
The soft-drink giant is one of the Olympics' biggest sponsors. But advocates argue pushing sugary beverages promotes obesity and diabetes worldwide, and is inconsistent with the values of the games.

(Image credit: Pascal Le Segretain)
item.dc:creator: Ronnie Cohen

item.title: Walz and legions of 'dudes' want to give men permission to vote Democrat
item.description: With the selection of Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, Vice President Harris continues a trend that has risen out of her run for president: clearing the way for men to identify with their gender as they vote.
item.content:encoded:
With the selection of Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, Vice President Harris continues a trend that has risen out of her run for president: clearing the way for men to identify with their gender as they vote.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: The most pressing question about Tim Walz and JD Vance: Who should play them on SNL?
item.description: Steve Martin has said he turned down an offer from SNL to play Walz. Our critic offers some alternatives.
item.content:encoded: Steve Martin has said he turned down an offer from SNL to play Walz. Our critic offers some alternatives.
item.dc:creator: Eric Deggans

item.title: At Versailles, a grand Olympic venue dazzles spectators and competitors alike
item.description: With the equestrian events in the books, the reviews are in: The temporary grandstand built on the estate of Versailles was "spectacular," "magnificent" and a source of pride for residents of France.
item.content:encoded:
With the equestrian events in the books, the reviews are in: The temporary grandstand built on the estate of Versailles was "spectacular," "magnificent" and a source of pride for residents of France.

(Image credit: Alex Broadway)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: 3rd person arrested over plot targeting now-canceled Taylor Swift shows in Vienna
item.description: Austria's interior minister said an 18-year-old was taken into custody Thursday evening in Vienna after allegedly being in contact with the main suspect.
item.content:encoded:
Austria's interior minister said an 18-year-old was taken into custody Thursday evening in Vienna after allegedly being in contact with the main suspect.

(Image credit: Heinz-Peter Bader)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Paris has become more accessible for disabled. Will it last after the Olympics?
item.description: The French capital has tried to improve accessibility for people with disabilities ahead of the Olympics and Paralympics. Challenges remain, however, particularly in the underground Metro system.
item.content:encoded:
The French capital has tried to improve accessibility for people with disabilities ahead of the Olympics and Paralympics. Challenges remain, however, particularly in the underground Metro system.

(Image credit: Tom Nouvian)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The grounds around a palace built by Louis XIV is hosting Olympic events
item.description: The Games in Paris include one of the grandest venues to ever host an Olympic event: the grounds of Versailles, where equestrian events and the pentathlon are held in sight of the opulent palace.
item.content:encoded: The Games in Paris include one of the grandest venues to ever host an Olympic event: the grounds of Versailles, where equestrian events and the pentathlon are held in sight of the opulent palace.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan
